abstract.p:
First-principles calculations based on the density functional theory (DFT) were carried out to study the atomic structure and electronic structure of LiAl 2(OH) 6Cl, the only material in the layered double hydroxide family in which delithiation was found to occur. Ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) simulations were used to explore the evolution of the structure of LiAl 2(OH) 6Cl during a thermally induced delithiation process. The simulations show that this process occurs due to the drastic dynamics of Li + at temperatures higher than ~450 K, in which the [Al 2(OH) 6] host layers remain stable up to 1100 K.
